title: InPost reports record parcel volumes in Q4 and full-year 2025
summary:
InPost Group has reported record parcel volumes in the fourth quarter and full year of 2025, driven by growth in B2C deliveries, international marketplaces and the integration of recent acquisitions in the UK and Spain.

The company handled 417.6 million parcels in Q4 2025, a 30% year-on-year increase. On its busiest day of the peak season, InPost processed more than 15 million parcels across Europe.

In Poland, Q4 volumes rose 5% year-on-year to 220.2 million parcels.

Continue reading InPost reports record parcel volumes in Q4 and full-year 2025 at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: Incheon eyes volume revival with incentives for new ocean services
summary:
Incheon wants to open routes beyond Asia since US tariffs brought a double-digit decline in South Korea’s second busiest port’s regional volumes last year.
The tariffs affected demand for components and intermediate goods from South-east Asia, despite front-loading increasing transpacific volumes by 20% year on year.
The port’s volumes from Thailand fell 20%, to 107,000 teu; Vietnam dipped 2.6%, to 381,000 teu; Indonesian cargo decreased 2%, to 68,000 teu; while Malaysian volumes ...

title: What 3PL execs must know about mandatory cyber incident reporting
summary:
The clock is ticking for third-party logistics providers.
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is set to finalize regulations implementing the Cyber Incident Reporting for Critical Infrastructure Act of 2022 (CIRCIA) by May 2026.
The rule will require critical infrastructure operators to notify CISA within 72 hours of discovering a “covered cyber incident” and within 24 hours of making a ransom payment in response to a ransomware attack.
For an industry ...

title: Charles Brewer: we are launching Malaysia into a new era of logistics

tweet: 🇲🇾 NEWS: Pos Malaysia launches the countrys first autonomous vehicle, ushering in a new era of logistics $POS

title: Pos Malaysia launches country’s first autonomous delivery vehicle
summary:
Pos Malaysia is rolling out the country’s first ever autonomous vehicle as part of its wider ambition to become a digitally enabled, sustainability-driven logistics leader.

The national postal operator will trial the Zelos fully driverless, 100% electric, zero-emission autonomous logistics vehicle for six months in partnership with Autonomous Logistic Solutions Sdn. Bhd (ALS) following the signing of a collaborative agreement between the two companies on January 21.

Speaking at the signing, Charles Brewer, group chief executive officer of Pos Malaysia said, “Today, we are not just launching an autonomous vehicle, we are launching Malaysia into a new era of logistics.

Continue reading Pos Malaysia launches country’s first autonomous delivery vehicle at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: LP Express delivers record parcel locker volumes
summary:
Lithuanian Post’s parcel locker delivery network, LP Express, handled more than three million parcels between the beginning of November and December 31, 2025 – a third more than during the same period in 2024.

According to the post, more than 1.1 million parcels were delivered to parcel lockers in Latvia and Estonia during the peak period – four times more than in 2024 – and the company handled a total 21 million parcels through its locker networks in Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia last year.

Continue reading LP Express delivers record parcel locker volumes at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: Omniva delivers record-breaking 50 million parcels globally
summary:
Omniva delivered over 50 million parcels globally in 2025, an increase of 11% compared to 2024, with 36 million parcels handled in the Baltics alone.

According to Omniva, the record-breaking parcel numbers reflect the continued growth of e-commerce, with 24% of parcels arriving in the Baltics originating from China – up from 21% in 2024.

“The largest growth came from international transit parcels, but deliveries to Latvia and Lithuania also showed strong growth,” said Sven Kukemelk, chief commercial officer of Omniva.

Continue reading Omniva delivers record-breaking 50 million parcels globally at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: Desperate carriers slash ocean rates to fill empty slots
summary:
Ocean-going carriers are slashing rates in a desperate bid to attract cargo before the Chinese New Year holiday next month.
On Friday, the Shanghai Container Freight Index showed Shanghai-North Europe down 5% on the previous week, to $1,595 per teu, or $2,607 per 40ft.
Shanghai-US West Coast rates also corrected by 5%, to $2,084 per 40ft, while a steeper decline, of 9%, was seen for Shanghai-US East Coast rates, which averaged $2,896 ...

title: London Gateway feels the pressure as throughput soars
summary:
The departure of Maersk from Felixstowe, combined with the choice of London Gateway as the Gemini Cooperation’s UK hub for Asia-Europe traffic, has propelled DP World to be the UK’s largest container terminal operator.
The Dubai-headquartered firm announced last week that its two UK facilities, London Gateway and Southampton, had together handled more than 5m teu in 2025, likely putting the operator on course to overtake Hutchison Port Holdings, which operates ...

title: WiseTech CEO on CargoWise pricing: ‘We knew this would be disruptive’
summary:
WiseTech Global CEO Zubin Appoo has acknowledged that the rollout of CargoWise’s new pricing model has been disruptive for freight forwarders, but insists the company has not engineered a cash “grab”, and says many customers will pay exactly the same as before under transitional protections. 
In a wide-ranging interview with The Loadstar, Mr Appoo addressed the issues that have dominated industry discussion since CargoWise Value Packs were announced at the end of ...

title: Ceva Logistics to open new warehouse in Spain to support Daikin growth
summary:
As an expansion of its 21-year collaboration with air conditioning manufacturer Daikin, Ceva Logistics is constructing a 27,000m2 warehouse in Tórtola de Henares, Spain that will support its customer’s growth plans.

The new warehouse, which broke ground in December and is expected to go into operation in the first quarter of 2027, is designed to optimize Daikin’s logistics flows.

Puerto Ahedo, contract logistics leader, Spain, Ceva Logistics, said, “This project represents a key milestone in the relationship between Ceva Logistics and Daikin.

title: Omniva to install parcel lockers in Estonian villages starting in March
summary:
Omniva is to begin installing a new network of parcel lockers designed for smaller communities in Estonian villages in March, expanding access to parcel services outside major population centers.

The international logistics and technology group said 150 parcel lockers will be installed across Estonia this spring, with around 400 planned by the end of the year. The rollout is aimed at making it more convenient to send and receive parcels in rural areas, with locations selected in cooperation with local municipalities.

Continue reading Omniva to install parcel lockers in Estonian villages starting in March at Parcel and Postal Technology International.
